name: unfavorably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not give you an advantage or a good chance of success: The salaries compare unfavorably to other fields of work. It was only a small country, unfavorably situated, with an indifferent soil.
in a negative way that shows that you do not like something: You might look at her home routine and compare it very unfavorably with my busy job in the city. I will look unfavorably at people who can't be bothered to turn up to practice. See
unfavorable
More examplesFewer examplesThey were asked whether they felt they had been treated unfavorably in any way. His leadership is likely to be viewed unfavorably by the Pentagon.The nurses used to make a fuss of them and compare us unfavorably to them.
